problem_statement: Raw OCR output is typically a

with coordinates. A naive approach to reconstructing the text is to simply sort all words by their Y-coordinate (Top -> Bottom) and then X-coordinate (Left -> Right). In multi-column documents, this approach fails catastrophically, as it merges the first line of Column A with the first line of Column B (e.g.,

). The engineering solution requires analyzing the whitespace gaps. The Recursive X-Y Cut algorithm projects the bounding boxes onto the axes to find significant gaps (separators), recursively splitting the page into blocks (Columns/Paragraphs) before ordering the text within those blocks.
